com.cutterapi.tools

Class EncryptedConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cutterapi.tools.EncryptedConfiguration

  • public class EncryptedConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    This class makes it possible to create, edit and read encrypted configuration files. Its encryption is very simple and would not keep experienced hackers from manipulating your configuration, but it will make it impossible to manipulate for normal users.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      EncryptedConfiguration(java.io.File configurationFile, byte[] secretKey)
      Creates an EncryptedConfiguration and saves it in the given file

      This method changes the value of an existing key. ':' are removed from the input!

      This method can be used to check if a key has been defined in the given configuration

      Use this method to reload your configuration from file.
      void removeKey(java.lang.String keyName)

    • Constructor Detail

      • EncryptedConfiguration

        public EncryptedConfiguration(java.lang.String programIdentifier,
                              java.lang.String configurationName,
                              java.lang.String passphrase)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates an EncryptedConfiguration with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        programIdentifier - A unique name or ID for your software as string.
        configurationName - The name of this configuration (this makes it possible to have multiple configuration files for the same piece of software).
        passphrase - The passphrase to encrypt your configuration with (maximum length 256 Bytes)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • EncryptedConfiguration

        public EncryptedConfiguration(java.lang.String programIdentifier,
                              java.lang.String configurationName,
                              byte[] secretKey)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates an EncryptedConfiguration with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        programIdentifier - A unique name or ID for your software as string.
        configurationName - The name of this configuration (this makes it possible to have multiple configuration files for the same piece of software).
        secretKey - The secret key to encrypt your configuration with. Use the getUserDependendKeyPhrase()-method if you do not know what to choose.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • EncryptedConfiguration

        public EncryptedConfiguration(java.io.File configurationFile,
                              java.lang.String passphrase)
        Creates an EncryptedConfiguration and saves it in the given file
        Parameters:
        configurationFile - This needs to be a full filepath with filename
        passphrase - The passphrase to encrypt your configuration with

      • EncryptedConfiguration

        public EncryptedConfiguration(java.io.File configurationFile,
                              byte[] secretKey)
        Creates an EncryptedConfiguration and saves it in the given file
        Parameters:
        configurationFile - This needs to be a full filepath with filename
        secretKey - The secret key to encrypt your configuration with. Use the getUserDependendKeyPhrase()-method if you do not know what to choose.

          throws java.lang.Exception

      • reloadConfiguration

        public void reloadConfiguration()
        Use this method to reload your configuration from file. Discards any changes.

      • defineKey

        public void defineKey(java.lang.String keyName,

        value -
        Throws:
